meanings.definition: Situated or located within a town or city.
meanings.sent1: The new bakery is intown, right next to the library.
meanings.sent2: I prefer living intown because everything is close by.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was intown when it wandered into the bustling market.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt intown, surrounded by the familiar sights and sounds.
meanings.sent5: The intown cafe had the most delicious pastries I've ever tasted.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the central part of a town or city.
meanings.sent1: The intown park is perfect for picnics and relaxation.
meanings.sent2: The intown shops are always busy with locals and tourists.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made an intown home in the tree at the town square.
meanings.sent4: His mind was intown, focused on the heart of the city's activities.
meanings.sent5: The intown museum showcases the history and culture of the area beautifully.
